content.description: Climb left facing ramp up to mini roof. Pass the mini roof using a big side pull. Then zig zag up section of good holds and crimps. Merge with "Purple haze" right before the roof. Continue up the roof to the same anchor as "Purple haze"
content.protection: Cams, Nuts. Suggested to top rope after climbing purple haze.
content.location: Left of "Purple haze" (shares anchor and top section.)

content.description: Start with an awkward balance move (tiny cams) to a ledge with a sizeable detached block (stable enough to climb past, but not to place gear behind), then straight up past the bolts (crux). It's also possible to use either arete, which drops the grade a bit.[ It has been reported that there are “ a few lose blocks and lots of lichen”  2021 R. Hall, Maine Admin, MtnPrjct ]
content.protection: Light rack to 1", two protection bolts, two-bolt anchor.
content.location: About 30' up and left from the prominent chimney is a narrow slabby face with two bolts.

content.description: Circumvent the big roof to its right, then climb straight up the slab past horizontal cracks and one protection bolt.
content.protection: Light rack to 2", one protection bolt, two-bolt anchor.
content.location: Start at the very base of the detached pillar, under the right end of the big roof.

content.description: Climb the center of the featured slab.
content.location: From the right (east) end of the big chimney, go down and right around a steep fin of rock; the route climbs the center of the slab on its right.

content.description: After a short step move to get started, the climb mostly consists of delicate stemming between the main wall and the outside corner of the pillar.
content.protection: Standard rack to 3" with mostly smaller gear; two-bolt anchor. From below, it's hard to imagine there's any protection, but don't be intimidated.
content.location: Start outside the left (west) end of the large chimney.

content.description: Start up a short, left-leaning corner, then move right into a steep flared corner with a thin finger crack on its left. At the top of the corner, step up left past a bolt, then pull the left end of the overhang. The start is mossy and takes a while to dry.
content.protection: Light rack to 2", one protection bolt, two-bolt anchor.
content.location: Head through the big chimney behind the pillar and crawl out its right (east) side. A three-trunked oak marks the start of the route.

content.description: Follow steep cracks up and over the chockstones to emerge in daylight, then follow a blocky crack and corner system on the main wall. Watch for loose rock.
content.location: Start near the right (east) end of the big chimney behind the pillar, under some large chockstones.

content.description: Follow the painfully sharp finger crack, taking advantage of every opportunity to stem off the pillar. This climb tends to be quite dirty.
content.protection: Standard rack, mostly small to medium sizes. Two-bolt anchor.
content.location: Start deep in the big chimney behind the pillar. The route follows a sharp-edged finger crack on the main wall.

content.description: Climb up on the right to avoid the big roof, then work left across the slab on diagonal cracks to a short right-facing corner. Pull up onto a ledge (crux), clip a bolt, then continue to the top of the pillar.
content.protection: Light rack to 1", one protection bolt, two-bolt anchor. A very small offset cam is nice for the crux move.
content.location: Start at the very base of the large free-standing pillar, at the right end of the big roof.

content.description: A very puzzling start (bolt) leads to easier climbing. Don't miss the cam placement in the very back of the large horizontal crack above the crux.
content.protection: One bolt, cams or Tricams 0.3-0.6" (optional # 4), two-bolt anchor.
content.location: The narrow, left-angling slab at the top of the gully, up and left from Where the Vultures Go.

content.description: Follow the obvious wide crack, stemming across the chimney against the pillar as much as possible (much easier for tall people). Continue past the Revolution anchors to the ledge and anchor above Where the Vultures Go.
content.location: Start just inside the left (west) end of the prominent chimney. The route goes up the wide crack in the corner, on the main wall.

content.description: Follow steep flakes out right, then straight up, bearing left along a short diagonal crack near the top.User Cameron Pinchback suggests: "Very sustaining. If top roping it is helpful to clip the second or third bolt to keep the rope from pulling you off the climb. " R Hall ME, Admin. ]
content.protection: Five bolts, green Alien or equivalent for top, optional #3 Camalot at start; two-bolt anchor.
content.location: Start below the left (west) end of the big chimney. The route climbs the steep face right of the chimney.

content.description: This small crag is located high above the right end of Barrett's Cove Cliff. It is shady, breezy, and generally a good choice for hot days. Its most distinctive feature is a large free-standing pillar separated from the main wall by a chimney.
